item.name: Characters

request.description:
## /characters

Gets a full list of all the characters in the available in the database. 

The results can be filtered by using: 

* name=value
* age=value
* movie=value

Example: /characters?movie=1&age=19

response.name: Query validation error

request.description:
## POST /characters This is used to create a new character. To use it, you need to specify the following fields:
Field Description Required
Name Name of the character. This value is unique. Yes
Age Age of the character. Must be an integer. Yes
Weight Weight of the character. Can be a decimal value. Ex 55.12 Yes
History Short description of the history of the character. This field can be up to 300 characters. Yes
Image A picture of the character. The format needs to be jpg, jpeg or png. Yes
Movies All the movies the new character as been part of. You need to use the movies ids separated by comma. Ex 1,2,5 No

response.name: Validation error

request.description:
## GET /characters/:id

Gets the detailed information of a character.

## PUT /characters/:id

Updates a character following the same format/validations as POST method

response.name: Validation Error

item.description:
## Characters Crud

This is the documentation for the characters endpoint. 

You need have an authenticated user to make use of this endpoint and actions.
